original:
The Great Bengal Famine of 1770 was a catastrophic event that resulted in the deaths of an estimated 10 million people, according to economist Amartya Sen. Sen characterized this famine as manmade, attributing its severity to various socio-economic factors and policies.

In contrast, during the same period in England, measures such as poor laws and charitable initiatives helped protect many individuals from starvation. For instance, in
